original: Eveland, Torsten Gustaf, polismästare o. stadsfiskal, Linköping, f. 14/6/ 99 i Hägenås, Jämtl. 1., av folksk:insp. Erik E. o. Anna Carlström. G. 39 m. Sonja Pehrson. Barn: Ulf f. 44. — Stud:ex. i Östersund 18, jur. kand. i Sthlm 26, res:off:ex. 22. Löjtn. i Gotl. art:kårs res. 27. Tjg. å sv. konsul. i Rouen 26-27, tingstjg. i Jämtl. västra o. Livgedingets doms. 28-30, e. länsnot. i Jämtl. 1. 30, tf. landsfogde där 33-37, krigsfiskal v. Jämtl. fält-jäg:reg. o. Norrl. art:reg. 34-37, stads-fiskal i Söderhamn 37-38, tf. stadsfiskal i Sthlm 39, polismäst. o. stadsfiskal i Linköp. sed. 40, krigsfiskal v. Östg. luftv:reg. o. Östg. flygflott. sed. 43.
translated: Eveland, Torsten Gustaf, police chief and city prosecutor, Linköping, b. June 14, 1899 in Hägenås, Jämtland County, son of elementary school inspector Erik E. and Anna Carlström. Married in 1939 to Sonja Pehrson, they have one son, Ulf, born in 1944. He passed the school leaving exam in Östersund in 1918, earned a law degree in Stockholm in 1926, and passed the reserve officer exam in 1922. He served as lieutenant in the Gotland Artillery Corps from 1927 to 1937. He was appointed to the Swedish consulate in Rouen from 1926 to 1927, and served as a court clerk in Jämtland western district and the Life Judgments Court from 1928 to 1930. He became a county notary in Jämtland County from 1930, acting county governor there from 1933 to 1937, and served as a war prosecutor in the Jämtland Field Ranger Regiment and the Norrland Artillery Regiment from 1934 to 1937. He served as city prosecutor in Söderhamn from 1937 to 1938, acting city prosecutor in Stockholm in 1939, and has been police chief and city prosecutor in Linköping since 1940. He has also served as a war prosecutor in the Östergötland Air Force Regiment and the Östergötland Air Force fleet since 1943.

jobs.name: Jämtland Western District and Life Judgments Court

Östergötland Air Force Regiment and Östergötland Air Force Fleet
